attributes.action: Reduce Net Greenhouse Gas Emissions To ZERO by 2025!
attributes.additional_details:
Assuming the world pumped out about 42 gigatonnes (Gt) of CO2 in 2018, we would have to cut out 6Gt every year – to hit zero by 2025. There are two ways to go about this: Ramping up clean energy generation via renewable power, and simultaneously massively reducing the energy we use.
https://bit.ly/2VWOg2Z
... https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/oct/08/we-must-reduce-greenhouse-gas-emissions-to-net-zero-or-face-more-floods
... https://bit.ly/2ILiG4t
attributes.background: Under a zero-carbon scenario, the fossil-fuelled energy sector, which generates around 80% of global emissions, must be phased out fast: coal, oil, gas (including fracking). Also, all heating and transport would have to be weaned off carbon-based fuels onto clean electricity. We must act now!
